intro: Machaeranthera heterocarpa, commonly known as the showy tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange petals and dark purple centers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant is drought-tolerant and has a compact, bushy growth habit.
